metadata.title: CVE-2017-15671 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.27, when invoked with GLOB_TILDE, could skip freeing allocated memory when processing the ~ operator with a long user name, potentially leading to a denial of service (memory leak).

criterions.comment: glibc package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.27-3ubuntu1').
